intro: Staphidiastrum pulverulentum, commonly known as the dusty staphidiastrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open woodlands and savannas. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
